meanings.definition: Make a formal judgment or decision about a problem or disputed matter.
meanings.sent1: The judge adjudicated the case fairly.
meanings.sent2: The court adjudicated the land dispute between the neighbors.
meanings.sent3: The talking parrot adjudicated which color of seed was the tastiest.
meanings.sent4: The referee adjudicated the soccer match with precision.
meanings.sent5: The wise owl adjudicated the best nesting spot for the young birds.

meanings.definition: Officially decide who is right in a dispute.
meanings.sent1: The jury adjudicated the winner of the competition.
meanings.sent2: The committee adjudicated the disagreement between the students.
meanings.sent3: The playful puppy adjudicated who got the biggest bone.
meanings.sent4: The teacher adjudicated the classroom debate with grace.
meanings.sent5: The experienced mediator adjudicated the conflict resolution seminar.
